text: “@TheFactsBook: Lenticular clouds over Mount Fuji: http://t.co/88nVgQsHyc” @arunbaboon God blowing Os

Lenticular clouds are a natural phenomenon that occurs when moist air flows over a mountain or mountain range, creating a series of large-scale standing waves in the air. When the temperature at the crest of the wave drops to the dew point, moisture in the air condenses to form clouds. These clouds are known for their distinct, lens-like shape, and the image is consistent with the description of lenticular clouds over Mount Fuji. There is no apparent inconsistency between the text and the image that would suggest misinformation.
